@PJWNHSPtSafety Thanks Pete @PJWNHSPtSafety Iâ€™m doing great now thanks. A short, sharp, unexpected relapse... but had excellent care, was honest and open about it & looked after myself too... so Iâ€™m feeling so much better. Thanks for checking on me ðŸ’

@LiluWheeler @NHS_ELFT There are many many other options than train tracks. All mental health trusts have a crisisline, most 24/7. The Samaritans are amazing & many towns have drop-in centres. There are loads of other MH charities too, as well as using other community assets ðŸŠâ€â™‚ï¸ðŸš´â€â™‚ï¸ðŸŒ¼ðŸ¦†ðŸ‘¯â€â™€ï¸

@LiluWheeler @mattwRMN I agree there should be MUCH better information about alternatives to A&E for people in #mentalhealth crisis. I understand there are new facilities at @RoyalLondonHosp and many mental health Trusts are now working on alternatives through the â€œcrisis care concordatâ€ ðŸ‘ðŸ»

@mattwRMN Great to see initiatives coming up across the country for alternatives to A&E for people with #mentalhealth problems. @SWLSTG is a good example ðŸ‘ŒðŸ» based on a model from Birmingham (I think). Crisis Cafes such as @sabpNHS & @NHS_ELFT also very effective alternatives

@LiluWheeler My experience is consistently fantastic BECAUSE I live in the catchment area of @NHS_ELFT it has nothing to do with my job, my role or even my presence on social media. The Trust is rated outstanding & all the care I have seen other people receive has been the same Fab quality

Had to delete the tweet below; I got so many kind messages, likes, retweets & DMs... but it wasnâ€™t MY experience. I rushed the tweeting (lesson learnt!) & didnâ€™t note on that tweet it was about someone else. All ok now & sheâ€™s got help. Meanwhile, overawed by twitter love ðŸ¤—ðŸ’– xx https://t.co/crhoHNuIZx
RT @heathercaudle: The NHS England Safeguarding Team is recruiting for an interim Programme Manager. Go to NHS Jobs for our Interim Programâ€¦

11/11 Massive thanks to @NHS_ELFT CEO @NavinaEvans DoN @LorraineSunduza MD @DrGilluley & Iâ€™m sure @DrAmarShah is involved somewhere!
Your #mentalhealth services continue to be compassionate, responsive, thorough &wonderful ðŸ’ðŸ’ðŸ’ as the @CareQualityComm rightly know #outstanding https://t.co/S1jVaVNdT9

10/11 I canâ€™t remember all the lovely team who cared for me when I felt vulnerable; but I remember how each of them made me feel ðŸ¤—
-Special thanks to the Team Leader Charity for running a great showðŸ‘ŒðŸ» -& to Dr Sally for going the extra mile -All of the HTT were outstanding https://t.co/kDipA1BtRZ

9/11 After a final appt with the psychiatrist I was discharged on 12th July
In 2 weeks Iâ€™d benefited from intensive support, daily contact with HTT, medication review, CBT & I was well on my way to recovery
âœ…This is what Crisis Support is supposed to look & feel like ðŸŒšâž¡ï¸ðŸŒ

8/11 As well as all the face-to-face & phone support from the @NHS_ELFT HTT I was also signposted to the #hackney #crisiscafe, free online #CBT and #IAPT therapy
Well done to @NHSHomerton & @CityHackneyCCG for collaborative working & excellent commissioning ðŸ‘ðŸ»ðŸ‘ðŸ»ðŸ‘ðŸ» https://t.co/WjpCePGFQa

7/11 The team asked if there was anything else that may help me
ðŸ¤” Some #CBT for anxiety would be helpful... and as if by magic I received a call from HTT #psychologist the next day and two sessions of very helpful Cognitive Behaviour Therapy completed that week https://t.co/USxlcXdxLX

6/11 The psychiatrist liaised with the pharmacist & new prescription arranged & meds collected from Hospital pharmacy
The team even offered to bring the medication to me at home! But I picked it up myself

5/11 The psychiatrist & whole HTT made me feel supported, valued & like I mattered. This is crucial for people with depression & anxiety
Every contact with the team felt genuine & un-rushed with a strong focus on #recovery #Wellbeing & 24/7 compassionate community focussed care https://t.co/APmJmYdPQv

4/11 Comprehensive, thoughtful & challenging assessment by (lovely) psychiatrist. Assessment was about MY needs, not ticking boxes or KPIs
-What would help me? -How can the team help? -Whatâ€™s helped me in the past? -Would therapy be of help? -What meds have helped me before?

3/11 Taken on by the Home Treatment Team for support and treatment for relapse in #depression & #anxiety
Contacted by phone daily & offered home visits as well as 24/7 access to the Team
Arranged assessment with HTT psychiatrist on Wednesday
https://t.co/T40vmYnK3c

2/11 I was referred to the Home Treatment Team (HTT) on Sat 30 June; offered same day assessment but I chose the next day as more convenient for me
Offered home visit, but I chose to go to team base. Seen by compassionate, experienced, thorough & professional #mentalhealth nurse

RT @cityalan: I have just sat through one of the most powerful, challenging and important series of talks by people with lived experience aâ€¦

More people speaking, more hard truths:
â€œMy family & others have been repeatedly let down by the current #mentalhealth system. Thats why Im involved in this #CommPath @NCCMentalHealth
I want to help improve services for people with severe & enduring #mentalillness like my sonâ€

Hearing the hard truth from people:
â€œIâ€™m a gay Muslim man with lived experience of mental health& Im a carer Services have called me â€˜hard to reachâ€™; what does that mean?â€
â€œI have felt very valued as part of #CommPath; I was told Im 1 of the most important people at this tableâ€
Be mindful when youâ€™re talking to #carers that you get to understand more about the carer as a person too; it will help us work together and all feel better #CommPath

Listening to a Service User engaged in #commpath
